intro: Kadua rapensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a rough texture. Kadua rapensis is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
